14
15#ifndef ISC_QUOTA_H
16#define ISC_QUOTA_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file isc/quota.h
23 *
24 * \brief The isc_quota_t object is a simple helper object for implementing
25 * quotas on things like the number of simultaneous connections to
26 * a server. It keeps track of the amount of quota in use, and
27 * encapsulates the locking necessary to allow multiple tasks to
28 * share a quota.
29 */
30
31/***
32 *** Imports.
33 ***/
34
35#include <isc/atomic.h>
36#include <isc/lang.h>
37#include <isc/mutex.h>
38#include <isc/types.h>
39
40/*****
41 ***** Types.
42 *****/
43
44ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
45
46/*% isc_quota structure */
47struct isc_quota {
48 atomic_uint_fast32_t max;
49 atomic_uint_fast32_t used;
50 atomic_uint_fast32_t soft;
51};
52
53
54void
55isc_quota_init(isc_quota_t *quota, unsigned int max);
56/*%<
57 * Initialize a quota object.
58 */
59
60void
61isc_quota_destroy(isc_quota_t *quota);
62/*%<
63 * Destroy a quota object.
64 */
65
66void
67isc_quota_soft(isc_quota_t *quota, unsigned int soft);
68/*%<
69 * Set a soft quota.
70 */
71
72void
73isc_quota_max(isc_quota_t *quota, unsigned int max);
74/*%<
75 * Re-set a maximum quota.
76 */
77
78unsigned int
79isc_quota_getmax(isc_quota_t *quota);
80/*%<
81 * Get the maximum quota.
82 */
83
84unsigned int
85isc_quota_getsoft(isc_quota_t *quota);
86/*%<
87 * Get the soft quota.
88 */
89
90unsigned int
91isc_quota_getused(isc_quota_t *quota);
92/*%<
93 * Get the current usage of quota.
94 */
95
96isc_result_t
97isc_quota_reserve(isc_quota_t *quota);
98/*%<
99 * Attempt to reserve one unit of 'quota'.
100 *
101 * Returns:
102 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success
103 * \li #ISC_R_SOFTQUOTA Success soft quota reached
104 * \li #ISC_R_QUOTA Quota is full
105 */
106
107void
108isc_quota_release(isc_quota_t *quota);
109/*%<
110 * Release one unit of quota.
111 */
112
113isc_result_t
114isc_quota_attach(isc_quota_t *quota, isc_quota_t **p);
115/*%<
116 * Like isc_quota_reserve, and also attaches '*p' to the
117 * quota if successful (ISC_R_SUCCESS or ISC_R_SOFTQUOTA).
118 */
119
120isc_result_t
121isc_quota_force(isc_quota_t *quota, isc_quota_t **p);
122/*%<
123 * Like isc_quota_attach, but will attach '*p' to the quota
124 * even if the hard quota has been exceeded.
125 */
126
127void
128isc_quota_detach(isc_quota_t **p);
129/*%<
130 * Like isc_quota_release, and also detaches '*p' from the
131 * quota.
132 */
133
134ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
135
136#endif /* ISC_QUOTA_H */
137
